content.heading: HTML Block and Inline Elements
paragraphs:
Every HTML element has a default display value based on its type.

The two most common display values are block and inline.

content.heading: Inline Elements
paragraphs:

content.heading: The <div> Element
paragraphs:
The <div> element is used as a container for other HTML elements.

It has no required attributes but can use style, class, and id.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
London

London is the capital city of England.

content.heading: The <span> Element
paragraphs:
The <span> element is an inline container used to mark up a part of text.

It can also use style, class, and id for styling.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs: My mother has blue eyes and my father has dark green eyes.

content.heading: Chapter Summary
paragraphs:
Block-level elements start on a new line and take full width.

Inline elements do not start on a new line and take up only necessary width.

The <div> element is a block-level container, while the <span> element is an inline container.
